text: in a split second life in Istanbul is
shaken to the core yet again
this TV presenter inside the stadium
when the first explosion went off
outside the attacks believed to have
been a car bomb and a suicide bomb
struck at the heart of turkey's biggest
city although the football grant where
two of the country's top teams had
played had already emptied of supporters
the government says the car bomb was
close to where police were stationed
following the match and that the attacks
were against the security services and
citizens Turkey has suffered a wave of
violence over the last 12 months of the
injured taken to hospital 17 are having
surgery six are in intensive care no
group has yet said it was behind the
blasts but 10 arrests have been made
all of anguish McDole on the car that
was passing by was remotely detonated 45
seconds later a man was stopped where
policeman was standing and that person
blew himself up
Turkey faced two heinous bomb attacks as
more people lose their lives this
country will be wondering when it will
emerge from the violence
Salman tamasin BBC News
